abstract_summ: Also, by modelling the TCCpM curves with an asymmetrical time integral of a Normal Distribution, we were able to study, by fitting progressively larger data ensembles, how the fitting parameters change as more data becomes available.Methods: We combined a quarantined models with early stage evolution data in Italy (during February 20th - March 30th) to predict longer term evolution (March 30th, on ...) within different control measures.A sensitivity analysis is conducted to determine the robustness of model predictions to parameter values and the sensitive parameters are estimated from the real data on the COVID-19 pandemic in India.Both of these countries have reached a plateau in the number of Total Confirmed Cases per Million (TCCpM) residents, suggesting a trend to be followed by other affected regions.Using Hubei's data as a basis of analysis, we have studied the spreading rate of COVID-19 and modelled the epidemic center for 10 European countries.
title_summ: Monitoring the evolution of the COVID-19 pandemic in China, South Korea, Italy and USA through the net relative rate of infection of the total number of confirmed casesScrutinizing the heterogeneous spreading of COVID-19 outbreak in Brazilian territoryA study of SARS-CoV-2 evolution in Italy: from early days to secondary effects after social distancingAnalysing and comparing the COVID-19 data: The closed cases of Hubei and South Korea, the dark March in Europe, the beginning of the outbreak in South AmericaCOVID-19 spreading in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil: do the policies of social isolation really work?Comparative analysis of the diffusion of Covid-19 infection in different countriesModeling and forecasting the COVID-19 pandemic in IndiaCOVID-19 spreading in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil: do the policies of social isolation really work?
title_abstract_phrases: Methods: We combined a quarantined models with early stage evolution data in Italy (during February 20th - March 30th) to predict longer term evolution (March 30th, on ...) within different control measures.A sensitivity analysis is conducted to determine the robustness of model predictions to parameter values and the sensitive parameters are estimated from the real data on the COVID-19 pandemic in India.Both of these countries have reached a plateau in the number of Total Confirmed Cases per Million (TCCpM) residents, suggesting a trend to be followed by other affected regions.Also, by modelling the TCCpM curves with an asymmetrical time integral of a Normal Distribution, we were able to study, by fitting progressively larger data ensembles, how the fitting parameters change as more data becomes available.This work proposes a scheme to monitor the temporal evolution of the COVID-19 pandemic using the time series of its total number of confirmed cases in a given region.
